thread.title: Quincy Acy gives back to D-League teammates after inking contract with Nets
thread.title_full: Quincy Acy gives back to D-League teammates after inking contract with Nets

author: Gabrielle McMillen (gabrielle.McMillen@performgroup.com)
title: Quincy Acy gives back to D-League teammates after inking contract with Nets
text:
February 7, 2017 8:47pm  47pm EST Basketball, NBA, News, English, Brooklyn Nets The newest Nets signee had his own way of showing appreciation to those who helped him get back to the NBA. Quincy Acy (Getty Images) 
Updated at 8:47  47 p.m. ET 
Quincy Acy signed a two-year contract with the Nets, but he didn't forget about his Texas Legends squad. 
Upon inking the NBA deal last month, the forward gave each of his former D-League teammates $250 gift cards, while the team's staff members each received a pair of shoes, according to USA Today Sports . 
MORE: Luke Walton, Magic Johnson finally talk; Lakers great ready 'to grind' 
Acy orginally was given a 10-day contract with the Nets after starting the season with the Legends. He signed his second 10-day contract on Jan. 20, and on Jan. 30 he inked the two-year deal, according to the Nets . 
It's Quincy's fifth NBA team in five seasons. He was drafted by the Raptors in 2012 and has bounced around to the Mavericks, Kings and Knicks. 
Now that Acy will be making far more in the NBA, he must have been feeling very generous towards his Legends family. 
According to D-League rules, most players make between $19,000 and $26,000 per year. Watch This
